meaning: bathe, be favored with, bask in

onyomiExamples.meaning: yukata (light cotton kimono worn in the summer or used as a bathrobe)

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to dash over oneself (e.g. water), to take (e.g. shower), to bask in (e.g. the sun), to bathe in, to be flooded with (e.g. light), to be covered in, to suffer (e.g. an attack), to draw (e.g. criticism, attention, praise), to have heaped upon, to be showered with
